description: Simple 2-deliverable branding project for integration testing. Validates that Lisa can create strategic brand documents, run brand and accessibility checks, and complete successfully.

deliverables.title: Brand positioning statement
deliverables.description: Brand positioning statement for a hypothetical enterprise software company. Use classic positioning framework: For [target audience] who [need], [brand] is the [category] that [benefit] unlike [competitors] because [reason to believe]. Include: (1) Target audience definition (demographics and psychographics), (2) Positioning statement (one clear sentence), (3) Category specification, (4) Core benefit articulated, (5) Competitive differentiation (vs. 2 competitors), (6) Reason to believe (3 proof points with metrics). Word count: 400-500 words. Strategic, clear writing. Proper heading hierarchy for accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Target audience defined: demographics and psychographics
Reason to believe: 3 proof points with specific metrics
Proper heading hierarchy (H1 > H2 > H3, no skipped levels)
deliverables.notes: First test deliverable. Tests brand and accessibility quality gates (no SEO or readability score for strategic branding docs).

deliverables.title: Brand tagline options
deliverables.description: Create 5 tagline options for the brand defined in TEST-BRD-001. Each tagline must be 3-7 words. For each option, provide: (1) The tagline itself, (2) Rationale (how it connects to positioning), (3) Evaluation against criteria (clarity, differentiation, memorability, credibility, emotional resonance). Final recommendation: Choose best tagline with detailed reasoning. Usage guidelines: Where tagline should appear (with logo, marketing materials) and where it shouldn't (UI, technical docs). Word count: 300-400 words total. Clear structure with headings for accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: Rationale connects each tagline to positioning from BRD-001
deliverables.notes: Second test deliverable. Depends on TEST-BRD-001 positioning. Tests dependency handling, brand compliance, accessibility.
